intro: Navarretia leptalea subsp. bicolor, commonly known as the two-color navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The species is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and it typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. Its leaves are alternate and linear, often with a slight bluish-green hue. This plant is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to coastal climates with mild winters and cool, wet springs.
